title: Israel Day of Fifth : An unparalleled platform to make our voices heard
message:
This shift went well beyond the event’s new name, Israel Day on Fifth, formerly the Salute to Israel Parade and the Celebrate Israel Parade.
Many Israel Fellows are also leading trips to Israel for Jewish students through Taglit-Birthright Israel and for non-Jewish students through the Maccabee Task Force, providing these young adults with the transformative experience of discovering Israel firsthand at this crucial moment in the country’s history.
At The Jewish Agency, we confront today’s challenges by emphasizing the power of the collective.
Much like we did at the Israel Day on Fifth parade, we must continue to stand up for what we believe in: a strong State of Israel alongside a strong American Jewish community.
The writer is chairman of the Board of Governors of The Jewish Agency for Israel.

title: Shame on you : East Brunswick school administrators under fire for yearbook mistake
message:
Megahed was one of the audience of nearly 750 that crowded into the high school auditorium who spoke to the school board about the controversy which has roiled the suburban school district.
We also know the impact to students in East Brunswick and the entire East Brunswick community because of this oversight.
The 2024 East Brunswick High School yearbook removed the names of members of a Jewish student group and ran a photo of Muslim students instead.
I will always be reminded of this distressing event every time I open my high school yearbook."
This article originally appeared on MyCentralJersey.com: East Brunswick NJ schools under fire for yearbook mistake

title: New wave of diaspora Jews make aliyah amid war - The Jerusalem Post
message:
The October 7 Hamas attack on Israel sparked an emotionally charged phenomenon: a new wave of Jews choosing to move to Israel despite the war, lack of safety, and numerous challenges.
